text: I've always seen Dragon Quest as one of my favorite RPG series, but I feel like my appreciation has been growing even more as the years go by. Simple, magical, addictive, "comfort food" games, that's how I see Dragon Quest. Sugiyama's music is legendary.
author: SupraDarky

text: I'm just waiting for the day we get the Dragon Quest IX remake. That game is my favorite of all time.
author: DScribbleF

text: DScribbleF What the hell do you need a remake for? The DS version works fine.
author: OniLordMiki

text: Couldn't agree more.  DQ is just a good time, hands down.  Not to mention I usually play games with the sound down/off but DQ games I have to play with headphones on.  Final Fantasy music is great too but these have a way of hitting me in the feels every time.
author: James Johnson

text: DScribbleF I'm just waiting for Square to announce a release date for DQ 11 in the west
author: FinallyJeremy

text: I've only played DQVIII and as much as I like that game, it's also a very old-fashioned J-RPG, which makes it relentlessly hard at times. Especially as I am used to more modern types of RPG's, like FFVII etc. It's a beautiful game with awesome music, magical atmosphere and beautiful cel-shaded graphics but I found the battle system to be quite boring. The ability to save only in towns doesn't help either.
author: Kookosbanaani94

text: DScribbleF man I found DQIX wayyy too grindy. Still haven't gotten through it all yet lol
author: cwopre

text: I really understand what you mean, especially with the comfort food-part. I've always regarded Dragon Quest as a textbook perfect JRPG, as it has everything that makes a JRPG, with still the somewhat clichÃ© adventure-plot and good vs. evil-scene, but still has it's own quirks and more serious themes. It's like you know exactly what you're going to get when you go in, and it's even better than that - but it's still what you expected.
author: SweetWheatsy

text: Yea, the games really do have a comfort feel to them.Especially the music.
author: SirenoftheVoid

text: Neverma managed to reach the tier 3 monster jobs, it's a grindmare to level all the sub ones

text: This track is so sad it reminds me of when your still wondering if someone loves you

text: Very relaxing. Takes me away from the times I got lost finding those damn land pieces. I think classes took a big penalty like with dq6; dq3 and swords will always be my favorites in the series.

text: I liked playing this game and this is a nice track but I got so sick of most of the music as it was reused so often

text: This is the longest game I've ever played and I love every single second of it

text: Man dragon quest games are so much fun, I wish they made 10 for the 3ds and a physical mini collection of 1-3 on DS so you can collect them all for DS. As for 7 I need to pick it back up and finish my playthrough.

text: I'm playing this game right now for the first time and loving it.
author: Rachel Hendricks

text: Holy shit I love dragon quest
author: The WahMaster

text:
I remember picking this game up since I heard it had a ton of jobs and party setups you could experiment with.

And I speedran to get to unlock them as soon as I could, only 18 hours in did I finally finally get to try them out, aaaaaand. I was sorely disappointed. The jobs you are given completely suck, and I get that you start with bad jobs to unlock the good ones but... that's not exactly good design when you take a job that actively worsens your stats, go fight 1000 slimes so you master it and can ditch it until you unlock the better ones.

I enjoyed the music, but the gameplay just really didn't hook me.
author: sora8711

text: This of course being the Japanese version, as the American version got lousy synth.
author: jb1980ist

text: The synth version wasn't that bad. It was actually good
author: FinallyJeremy

text: I forgot that I bought this game for the 3ds so thank you for the reminder.  As for Sugiyama, I wholeheartedly agree that his music is legendary.  It's amazing that he is still composing music at 86 years old.
author: Eric C.

text: I've been playing this for a long time. It's like a story every time you play. I just hope I finish it one day haha

text: This game has a really good OST, but because of how long it is a lot of the tracks get really repetitive for me. Doesn't help that we didn't get the orchestra ost, for some reason.
